title: Titus Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Titus chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Titus Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Titus Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:1, who should believers be subject to?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:1 instructs believers to be subject to principalities and powers, indicating submission to governing authorities.

questions.question: What attitude should believers show to all men according to Titus 3:2?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:2 commands believers to be gentle and show all meekness unto all men.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Titus 3:3 says, 'For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers ______ and pleasures.'
questions.explanation: Titus 3:3 describes serving divers lusts and pleasures as a state believers were once in.

questions.question: True or False: According to Titus 3:5, we are saved by works of righteousness we have done.
questions.explanation: Titus 3:5 states that we are not saved by works of righteousness, but according to God's mercy.

questions.question: Who is mentioned in Titus 3:6 as the one through whom the Holy Ghost is shed abundantly?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:6 explains that the Holy Ghost is shed abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:7, being justified by grace, we are made heirs according to the hope of what?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:7 teaches that justification by grace makes us heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

questions.question: What does Titus 3:8 say believers should be careful to maintain?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:8 instructs believers to be careful to maintain good works as these are profitable.

questions.question: What types of things does Titus 3:9 advise to avoid?
options: Foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law
questions.explanation: Titus 3:9 warns against engaging in foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 3:10 advises to reject a man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition.
questions.explanation: Titus 3:10 clearly states that a man who is an heretick should be rejected after first and second admonition.

questions.question: Who does Paul mention he will send to Titus in Titus 3:12?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:12 mentions that Paul will send Artemas or Tychicus to Titus.

questions.question: Where does Paul say he has determined to winter in Titus 3:12?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:12 states Paul has determined to winter at Nicopolis.

questions.question: What two men does Titus 3:13 instruct to bring on their journey diligently?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:13 instructs to bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:14, what should believers learn to maintain?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:14 exhorts believers to learn to maintain good works for necessary uses.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 3:11 says that a heretick is condemned of himself.
questions.explanation: Titus 3:11 teaches that a heretick sins and is condemned by himself.

questions.question: Who sends salutations to Titus in Titus 3:15?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:15 says that all who are with Paul salute Titus.

medium.title: Titus Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Titus Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Titus 3 teach us to relate to governing authorities and be prepared in our daily lives?
options: Be subject to principalities and powers, obey magistrates, and be ready to every good work
Ignore government leaders and focus only on spiritual matters
Challenge authorities who do not agree with us
Only obey authorities when it benefits us personally
questions.correctAnswer: Be subject to principalities and powers, obey magistrates, and be ready to every good work
questions.explanation: Titus 3:1 instructs believers to be subject to governing authorities and to be ready for every good work, emphasizing obedience and preparedness in daily life.

questions.question: What attitude does Titus 3 recommend believers should have toward others, especially when facing conflict?
options: Speak evil of no man, avoid brawling, and show all meekness unto all men
Defend yourself vigorously and never back down
Speak your mind freely, even if it causes strife
questions.correctAnswer: Speak evil of no man, avoid brawling, and show all meekness unto all men
questions.explanation: According to Titus 3:2, believers are called to avoid slander, brawling, and instead exhibit gentleness and meekness to all, promoting peace and humility.

questions.question: A fellow believer feels discouraged about their past sins. According to Titus 3, what truth about God's mercy would you share to encourage them?
options: God saved us not by works but according to His mercy, through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Ghost
We must earn God's favor by doing many good deeds
Our past mistakes disqualify us permanently
God only helps those who never sin
questions.correctAnswer: God saved us not by works but according to His mercy, through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Titus 3:5-6 teaches that salvation comes through God's mercy and spiritual renewal, not by our works, encouraging believers to trust in God's grace despite past sin.

questions.question: Based on Titus 3, how should believers view and maintain good works in their daily lives?
options: They should be careful to maintain good works as they are profitable and good for men
Good works are optional and not necessary for faith
Good works are only for church leaders
Good works are a way to earn salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They should be careful to maintain good works as they are profitable and good for men
questions.explanation: Titus 3:8 encourages believers to affirm and be diligent in good works, highlighting their benefit and importance in Christian living.

questions.question: What does Titus 3 advise about engaging in foolish disputes and genealogies?
options: Avoid them because they are unprofitable and vain
Engage fully to prove your knowledge
Use them to win arguments against others
Focus on them as they are the heart of doctrine
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid them because they are unprofitable and vain
questions.explanation: Titus 3:9 warns against foolish questions and contentions about the law, emphasizing they do not benefit spiritual growth.

questions.question: How should the church respond to a person who is a heretic after repeated admonitions, according to Titus 3?
options: Reject him after the first and second admonition
Keep trying indefinitely to convince him
Ignore the problem and hope it resolves
Allow him to continue teaching without correction
questions.correctAnswer: Reject him after the first and second admonition
questions.explanation: Titus 3:10 instructs to reject a heretic after giving two warnings, to protect the church from harmful teaching.

questions.question: What reason is given in Titus 3 for rejecting a heretic after admonition?
options: He is subverted, sins, and is condemned by his own judgment
He is simply mistaken but well-meaning
He is confused and needs more teaching
He wants to learn and grow in faith
questions.correctAnswer: He is subverted, sins, and is condemned by his own judgment
questions.explanation: Titus 3:11 explains that a heretic who refuses correction is spiritually ruined and self-condemned.

questions.question: According to Titus 3, what should believers do to help others who are on their journey or mission?
options: Provide diligently for their needs so that nothing is lacking
Ignore their needs and focus on yourself
Criticize their efforts if they seem insufficient
Only help if they have helped you first
questions.correctAnswer: Provide diligently for their needs so that nothing is lacking
questions.explanation: Titus 3:13 encourages believers to assist others like Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey, showing care and hospitality.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "And let ours also learn to maintain ___ for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful."
questions.explanation: Titus 3:14 instructs that believers should learn to maintain good works to be fruitful and meet necessary needs.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 3 teaches that believers are saved by their own righteous works.
questions.explanation: Titus 3:5 clearly states that salvation is not by works of righteousness but according to God's mercy through regeneration and renewal by the Holy Spirit.

questions.question: What motivation for hope does Titus 3 give believers who are justified by God's grace?
options: Being made heirs according to the hope of eternal life
questions.correctAnswer: Being made heirs according to the hope of eternal life
questions.explanation: Titus 3:7 teaches that justification by grace leads believers to be heirs with the hope of eternal life, encouraging perseverance and faith.

questions.question: How does Titus 3 describe believers' former lives before receiving God's kindness and love?
options: Foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy
questions.explanation: Titus 3:3 describes the former state of believers as foolish and disobedient, highlighting the contrast with the transformation by God's mercy.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 3 encourages believers to greet and show fellowship with those who love them in the faith.
questions.explanation: Titus 3:15 ends with a call to greet those who love the believers in the faith, emphasizing fellowship and unity.

questions.question: What example does Titus 3 give of practical hospitality and support within the Christian community?
options: Sending Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey with diligence that nothing be wanting
Ignoring those who travel for ministry
Only supporting those from your own local church
Focusing solely on your personal spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Sending Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey with diligence that nothing be wanting
questions.explanation: Titus 3:13 illustrates practical support by urging believers to assist those traveling for ministry, showing care and stewardship.

questions.question: According to Titus 3, what should be the believer's response to God's kindness and love appearing toward man?
options: Be renewed by the Holy Ghost and live a life marked by good works
Continue living as before without change
Depend solely on personal effort to be righteous
Ignore God's mercy and focus on law-keeping
questions.correctAnswer: Be renewed by the Holy Ghost and live a life marked by good works
questions.explanation: Titus 3:4-5 describes God's kindness appearing and resulting in believers' renewal by the Spirit, leading to a transformed life with good works.

hard.title: Titus Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Titus Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:5, what is the basis of our salvation?
options: Works of righteousness we have done
questions.explanation: Titus 3:5 states salvation is not by works of righteousness but according to God's mercy, emphasizing grace over human effort.

questions.question: What does Titus 3:1 instruct believers to be subject to?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:1 instructs believers to be subject to principalities and powers, indicating respect for governing authorities.

questions.question: Titus 3:2 calls believers to avoid what behavior?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:2 exhorts believers not to be brawlers but to show meekness and gentleness.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'washing of regeneration' in Titus 3:5 likely refer to?
questions.explanation: The 'washing of regeneration' in Titus 3:5 is understood as a typology for baptism representing spiritual rebirth.

questions.question: How does Titus 3:3 describe the former state of believers before salvation?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:3 recounts believers' past as foolish, disobedient, and deceived, highlighting transformation by grace.

questions.question: What is the significance of 'justified by his grace' in Titus 3:7?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:7 emphasizes justification as a legal declaration by God based on grace, not works.

questions.question: Which theme in Titus 3:4-6 is echoed in the Old Testament concept of 'chesed' (steadfast love)?
options: Kindness and love of God appearing
questions.correctAnswer: Kindness and love of God appearing
questions.explanation: The kindness and love of God in Titus 3:4 reflect the Hebrew concept of chesed, God’s covenantal loving-kindness.

questions.question: In Titus 3:9, what type of discussions are believers instructed to avoid?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:9 advises avoiding unprofitable contentions such as foolish questions and genealogies to maintain focus on faith.

questions.question: The instruction to "reject a heretick after the first and second admonition" in Titus 3:10 reveals what about early church discipline?
options: A process of repeated warnings before exclusion
questions.correctAnswer: A process of repeated warnings before exclusion
questions.explanation: Titus 3:10 shows the early church’s patient but firm approach to heresy, allowing for correction before rejection.

questions.question: How does Titus 3:8 connect faith and works?
options: Believers should maintain good works as a result of faith
Faith alone is sufficient without works
Works earn salvation apart from faith
Faith is unimportant compared to works
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should maintain good works as a result of faith
questions.explanation: Titus 3:8 encourages believers who have faith in God to be careful to maintain good works, showing faith and works are complementary.

questions.question: What is the historical significance of Nicopolis mentioned in Titus 3:12?
options: A city founded by Octavian to commemorate a victory
A major temple city in Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: A city founded by Octavian to commemorate a victory
questions.explanation: Nicopolis, where Paul planned to winter (Titus 3:12), was founded by Octavian (Augustus) after the Battle of Actium, situating the letter in a Roman imperial context.

questions.question: True or False: Titus 3:6 indicates the Holy Ghost was given sparingly to believers.
questions.explanation: Titus 3:6 says the Holy Ghost was shed abundantly, not sparingly, emphasizing the richness of the gift.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Titus 3:3 to describe the believers’ former state?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:3 uses parallelism by listing negative traits in a balanced, poetic structure to emphasize spiritual folly.

questions.question: In Titus 3:14, what is the intended outcome of believers maintaining good works?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:14 connects good works with spiritual fruitfulness, highlighting productive Christian living.

questions.question: The phrase 'heirs according to the hope of eternal life' in Titus 3:7 alludes to which Old Testament promise?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:7’s reference to heirs echoes the Abrahamic covenant promise of inheriting blessings and eternal life.

theological.title: Titus Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Titus Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:1, what attitude are believers instructed to have toward governing authorities?
options: To be subject to principalities and powers, and obey magistrates
To only obey authorities when convenient
questions.correctAnswer: To be subject to principalities and powers, and obey magistrates
questions.explanation: Titus 3:1 commands believers to be subject to governing authorities, showing respect and obedience. This aligns with Romans 13:1-2, 1 Peter 2:13-17, and Proverbs 24:21, emphasizing submission to God-ordained authority.

questions.question: What character traits does Titus 3:2 exhort believers to demonstrate toward others?
options: Gentleness, meekness, and refraining from speaking evil
questions.correctAnswer: Gentleness, meekness, and refraining from speaking evil
questions.explanation: Titus 3:2 instructs believers to avoid slander and quarrels, instead showing gentleness and meekness. This reflects teachings in Ephesians 4:31-32, Colossians 3:12, and James 1:19 about humility and kindness.

questions.question: What is the nature of humanity before salvation as described in Titus 3:3?
options: Foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving lusts and pleasures
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving lusts and pleasures
questions.explanation: Titus 3:3 depicts humanity's fallen condition characterized by folly, disobedience, deception, and sinful desires, consistent with Romans 3:10-18, Ephesians 2:1-3, and Jeremiah 17:9.

questions.question: What event or reality brought about salvation according to Titus 3:4-5?
options: The kindness and love of God our Savior appearing, saving us by His mercy
questions.correctAnswer: The kindness and love of God our Savior appearing, saving us by His mercy
questions.explanation: Titus 3:4-5 emphasizes salvation as an act of God's mercy and loving-kindness, not by human works, paralleling Ephesians 2:8-9, Romans 9:16, and John 3:16.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:5, by what means does God save us?
options: By the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: By the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Titus 3:5 states salvation comes through spiritual regeneration and renewal by the Holy Spirit, consistent with John 3:3-5, Ezekiel 36:25-27, and 2 Corinthians 5:17.

questions.question: Who is the agent through whom the Holy Spirit is abundantly given, according to Titus 3:6?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:6 teaches that the Holy Spirit is given abundantly through Jesus Christ, aligning with John 16:7, Acts 2:33, and Hebrews 9:14 where Christ is the mediator of the Spirit.

questions.question: What is the result of being justified by God's grace as stated in Titus 3:7?
options: Being made heirs according to the hope of eternal life
questions.correctAnswer: Being made heirs according to the hope of eternal life
questions.explanation: Titus 3:7 teaches justification by grace results in the status of heirs with a confident hope in eternal life, consistent with Romans 5:1-2, Galatians 3:26-29, and Hebrews 6:17-18.

questions.question: What does Titus 3:8 say believers should be careful to maintain?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:8 exhorts believers to be diligent in maintaining good works, showing their faith’s fruitfulness, which echoes James 2:14-26, Ephesians 2:10, and Matthew 5:16.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:9, what types of disputes should believers avoid?
options: Foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and law strivings
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and law strivings
questions.explanation: Titus 3:9 warns against unprofitable disputes that cause division, similar to 2 Timothy 2:23-24, 1 Timothy 1:4, and Proverbs 17:14 about avoiding useless arguments.

questions.question: What is the instruction given regarding a person who is a heretic after admonitions, according to Titus 3:10?
options: Reject him after the first and second admonition
Keep engaging in debate with him
questions.correctAnswer: Reject him after the first and second admonition
questions.explanation: Titus 3:10 directs firm church discipline toward persistent heretics, consistent with Matthew 18:15-17 and 2 Timothy 3:5 to protect the church’s purity.

questions.question: What does Titus 3:11 say about the one who is a heretic?
options: He is subverted, sins, and is self-condemned
He is innocent and should be forgiven immediately
He is a model for others
questions.correctAnswer: He is subverted, sins, and is self-condemned
questions.explanation: Titus 3:11 describes heretics as self-condemned through their sin and divisive behavior, paralleling Galatians 5:12 and 2 Peter 2:1-3 about destructive false teachers.

questions.question: What practical instruction is given in Titus 3:13 concerning Zenas and Apollos?
options: Bring them on their journey diligently, ensuring nothing is lacking
questions.correctAnswer: Bring them on their journey diligently, ensuring nothing is lacking
questions.explanation: Titus 3:13 instructs hospitality and provision for fellow workers, reflecting the biblical principle of supporting those who labor in the gospel (Romans 16:1-2; 3 John 5-8).

questions.question: What is the purpose of learning to maintain good works as stated in Titus 3:14?
options: To be fruitful and meet necessary needs
questions.correctAnswer: To be fruitful and meet necessary needs
questions.explanation: Titus 3:14 teaches that good works are to be maintained for practical use and fruitfulness, consistent with Galatians 6:9-10 and 1 Timothy 5:8 about Christian responsibility.

questions.question: Who does Paul plan to send to Titus according to Titus 3:12?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:12 mentions Paul’s intention to send Artemas or Tychicus to Titus, similar to other mentions in Acts 20:4 and 2 Timothy 4:12 showing trusted coworkers in ministry.

questions.question: What blessing does Paul pronounce at the conclusion of Titus 3:15?
questions.explanation: Titus 3:15 ends with a benediction of grace, a common apostolic blessing seen in 2 Corinthians 13:14, Romans 16:20, and Jude 1:2 emphasizing God’s unmerited favor.
